vdtcore_common.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * vdtcore_common.h
00003  * Common functions for the vdt routines.
00004  * The basic idea is to exploit Pade polynomials.
00005  * A lot of ideas were inspired by the cephes math library (by Stephen L.
00006  * Moshier
00007  * moshier@na-net.ornl.gov) as well as actual code for the exp, log, sin, cos,
00008  * tan, asin, acos and atan functions. The Cephes library can be found here:
00009  * http://www.netlib.org/cephes/
00010  *
00011  *  Created on: Jun 23, 2012
00012  *      Author: Danilo Piparo, Thomas Hauth, Vincenzo Innocente
00013  */
00014 
00015 /*
00016  * VDT is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
00017  * it under the terms of the GNU Lesser Public License as published by
00018  * the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
00019  * (at your option) any later version.
00020  *
00021  * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00022  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00023  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
00024  * GNU Lesser Public License for more details.
00025  *
00026  * You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser Public License
00027  * along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
00028  */

00037     namespace details {
00038         // Constants
00039         const double TWOPI = 2. * M_PI;
00040         const double PI = M_PI;
00041         const double PIO2 = M_PI_2;
00042         const double PIO4 = M_PI_4;
00043         const double ONEOPIO4 = 4. / M_PI;
00044 
00045         const float TWOPIF = 2. * M_PI;
00046         const float PIF = M_PI;
00047         const float PIO2F = M_PI_2;
00048         const float PIO4F = M_PI_4;
00049         const float ONEOPIO4F = 4. / M_PI;
00050 
00051         const double MOREBITS = 6.123233995736765886130E-17;
00052 
00053         const float MAXNUMF = 3.4028234663852885981170418348451692544e38f;

00055         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00056 
00059         union ieee754 {
00060             ieee754(){};
00061             ieee754(double thed) { d = thed; };
00062             ieee754(uint64_t thell) { ll = thell; };
00063             ieee754(float thef) { f[0] = thef; };
00064             ieee754(uint32_t thei) { i[0] = thei; };
00065             double d;
00066             float f[2];
00067             uint32_t i[2];
00068             uint64_t ll;
00069             uint16_t s[4];
00070         };
00071 
00072         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00073 
00075         inline double uint642dp(uint64_t ll) {
00076             ieee754 tmp;
00077             tmp.ll = ll;
00078             return tmp.d;
00079         }
00080 
00081         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 
00084         inline uint64_t dp2uint64(double x) {
00085             ieee754 tmp;
00086             tmp.d = x;
00087             return tmp.ll;
00088         }
00089 
00090         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00092         inline double dpANDuint64(const double x, const uint64_t i) {
00093             return uint642dp(dp2uint64(x) & i);
00094         }
00095         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00097         inline double dpORuint64(const double x, const uint64_t i) {
00098             return uint642dp(dp2uint64(x) | i);
00099         }
00100 
00102         inline double dpXORuint64(const double x, const uint64_t i) {
00103             return uint642dp(dp2uint64(x) ^ i);
00104         }
00105 
00106         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00107         inline uint64_t getSignMask(const double x) {
00108             const uint64_t mask = 0x8000000000000000ULL;
00109             return dp2uint64(x) & mask;
00110         }
00111 
00112         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00114         inline float uint322sp(int x) {
00115             ieee754 tmp;
00116             tmp.i[0] = x;
00117             return tmp.f[0];
00118         }
00119 
00120         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00122         inline uint32_t sp2uint32(float x) {
00123             ieee754 tmp;
00124             tmp.f[0] = x;
00125             return tmp.i[0];
00126         }
00127 
00128         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130         inline float spANDuint32(const float x, const uint32_t i) {
00131             return uint322sp(sp2uint32(x) & i);
00132         }
00133         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135         inline float spORuint32(const float x, const uint32_t i) {
00136             return uint322sp(sp2uint32(x) | i);
00137         }
00138 
00139         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141         inline float spXORuint32(const float x, const uint32_t i) {
00142             return uint322sp(sp2uint32(x) ^ i);
00143         }
00144         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00146         inline uint32_t getSignMask(const float x) {
00147             const uint32_t mask = 0x80000000;
00148             return sp2uint32(x) & mask;
00149         }
00150 
00151         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00153         inline double getMantExponent(const double x, double& fe) {
00154 
00155             uint64_t n = dp2uint64(x);
00156 
00157             // Shift to the right up to the beginning of the exponent.
00158             // Then with a mask, cut off the sign bit
00159             uint64_t le = (n >> 52);
00160 
00161             // chop the head of the number: an int contains more than 11 bits
00162             // (32)
00163             int32_t e =
00164                 le; // This is important since sums on uint64_t do not vectorise
00165             fe = e - 1023;
00166 
00167             // This puts to 11 zeroes the exponent
00168             n &= 0x800FFFFFFFFFFFFFULL;
00169             // build a mask which is 0.5, i.e. an exponent equal to 1022
00170             // which means *2, see the above +1.
00171             const uint64_t p05 = 0x3FE0000000000000ULL; // dp2uint64(0.5);
00172             n |= p05;
00173 
00174             return uint642dp(n);
00175         }
00176 
00177         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00179         inline float getMantExponentf(const float x, float& fe) {
00180 
00181             uint32_t n = sp2uint32(x);
00182             int32_t e = (n >> 23) - 127;
00183             fe = e;
00184 
00185             // fractional part
00186             const uint32_t p05f = 0x3f000000; // //sp2uint32(0.5);
00187             n &= 0x807fffff;                  // ~0x7f800000;
00188             n |= p05f;
00189 
00190             return uint322sp(n);
00191         }
00192 
00193         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00195         inline uint32_t fp2uint(float x) { return sp2uint32(x); }
00197         inline uint64_t fp2uint(double x) { return dp2uint64(x); }
00199         inline float int2fp(uint32_t i) { return uint322sp(i); }
00201         inline double int2fp(uint64_t i) { return uint642dp(i); }
00202 
00203         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00210         inline double fpfloor(const double x) {
00211             // no problem since exp is defined between -708 and 708. Int is
00212             // enough for it!
00213             int32_t ret = int32_t(x);
00214             ret -= (sp2uint32(x) >> 31);
00215             return ret;
00216         }
00217         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00224         inline float fpfloor(const float x) {
00225             int32_t ret = int32_t(x);
00226             ret -= (sp2uint32(x) >> 31);
00227             return ret;
00228         }
00229 
00230         //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00231     }

00233 } // end of namespace vdt
